019package org.jgrapes.webconsole.base;
020
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException;
023import java.net.URI;
024import java.net.URISyntaxException;
025import java.nio.CharBuffer;
026import java.text.ParseException;
027import java.util.ArrayList;
028import java.util.HashMap;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Locale;
031import java.util.Map;
032import java.util.Optional;
033import java.util.ResourceBundle;
034import java.util.UUID;
035import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
036import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpConstants.HttpStatus;
037import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpField;
038import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.protocols.http.HttpResponse;
039import org.jdrupes.httpcodec.types.Converters;
040import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;

052import org.jgrapes.http.events.ProtocolSwitchAccepted;
053import org.jgrapes.http.events.Request;
054import org.jgrapes.http.events.Request.In.Get;
055import org.jgrapes.http.events.Response;
056import org.jgrapes.http.events.Upgraded;
057import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
058import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
059import org.jgrapes.io.events.Input;
060import org.jgrapes.io.events.Output;
061import org.jgrapes.io.util.CharBufferWriter;
062import org.jgrapes.io.util.LinkedIOSubchannel;
063import org.jgrapes.util.events.KeyValueStoreQuery;
064import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConletResourceRequest;
065import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConsoleCommand;
066import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ConsoleReady;
067import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.JsonInput;
068import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.PageResourceRequest;
069import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.ResourceRequestCompleted;
070import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.SetLocale;
071import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.SetLocaleCompleted;
072import org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.events.SimpleConsoleCommand;
073
074/**
075 * The server side base class for a web console single page 
076 * application (SPA). Its two main tasks are to provide resources using 
077 * {@link Request}/{@link Response} events (see 
078 * {@link #onGet(org.jgrapes.http.events.Request.In.Get, IOSubchannel)}
079 * for details about the different kinds of resources) and to convert
080 * the JSON RPC messages received from the browser via the web socket
081 * to {@link JsonInput} events and fire them on the
082 * {@link ConsoleSession} channel.
083 * 
084 * The class has a counter part in the browser, the `jgconsole`
085 * JavaScript module (see 
086 * <a href="jsdoc/classes/Console.html">functions</a>)
087 * that can be loaded as `console-base-resource/jgconsole.js` 
088 * (relative to the configured prefix). 
089 * 
090 * The class also provides handlers for some console related events
091 * that affect the console representation in the browser.
092 */
093@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.ExcessiveImports", "PMD.NcssCount",
094    "PMD.TooManyMethods", "PMD.GodClass" })
095public abstract class ConsoleWeblet extends Component {
096
097    private static final String CONSOLE_SESSION_IDS
098        = ConsoleWeblet.class.getName() + ".consoleSessionId";
099    private static final String UTF_8 = "utf-8";
100
101    private URI prefix;
102    private final WebConsole console;
103    private ResourcePattern requestPattern;
104
105    private final RenderSupport renderSupport = new RenderSupportImpl();
106    private boolean useMinifiedResources = true;
107    private long psNetworkTimeout = 45_000;
108    private long psRefreshInterval = 30_000;
109    private long psInactivityTimeout = -1;
110
111    private List<Class<?>> consoleResourceSearchSeq;
112    private final List<Class<?>> resourceClasses = new ArrayList<>();
113    private final ResourceBundle.Control resourceControl
114        = new ConsoleResourceBundleControl(resourceClasses);
115    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseConcurrentHashMap")
116    private final Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> supportedLocales
117        = new HashMap<>();
118
119    /**
120     * The class used in handler annotations to represent the 
121     * console channel.
122     */
123    protected class ConsoleChannel extends ClassChannel {
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Instantiates a new console weblet. The weblet handles
128     * {@link Get} events for URIs that start with the
129     * specified prefix (see 
130     * {@link #onGet(org.jgrapes.http.events.Request.In.Get, IOSubchannel)}).
131     *
132     * @param webletChannel the weblet channel
133     * @param consoleChannel the console channel
134     * @param consolePrefix the console prefix
135     */
136    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.UseStringBufferForStringAppends")
137    public ConsoleWeblet(Channel webletChannel, Channel consoleChannel,
138            URI consolePrefix) {
139        this(webletChannel, new WebConsole(consoleChannel));
140
141        prefix = URI.create(consolePrefix.getPath().endsWith("/")
142            ? consolePrefix.getPath()
143            : consolePrefix.getPath() + "/");
144        console.setView(this);
145
146        String consolePath = prefix.getPath();
147        if (consolePath.endsWith("/")) {
148            consolePath = consolePath.substring(0, consolePath.length() - 1);
149        }
150        consolePath = consolePath + "|**";
151        try {
152            requestPattern = new ResourcePattern(consolePath);
153        } catch (ParseException e) {
154            throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
155        }
156        consoleResourceSearchSeq = consoleHierarchy();
157
158        resourceClasses.addAll(consoleHierarchy());
159        updateSupportedLocales();
160
161        RequestHandler.Evaluator.add(this, "onGet", prefix + "**");
162        RequestHandler.Evaluator.add(this, "onGetRedirect",
163            prefix.getPath().substring(
164                0, prefix.getPath().length() - 1));
165    }
166
167    private ConsoleWeblet(Channel webletChannel, WebConsole console) {
168        super(webletChannel, ChannelReplacements.create()
169            .add(ConsoleChannel.class, console.channel()));
170        this.console = console;
171        attach(console);
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Return the list of classes that form the current console
176     * weblet implementation. This consists of all classes from
177     * `getClass()` up to `ConsoleWeblet.class`. 
178     *
179     * @return the list
180     */
181    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
182    protected final List<Class<?>> consoleHierarchy() {
183        List<Class<?>> result = new ArrayList<>();
184        Class<?> derivative = getClass();
185        while (true) {
186            result.add(derivative);
187            if (derivative.equals(ConsoleWeblet.class)) {
188                break;
189            }
190            derivative = derivative.getSuperclass();
191        }
192        return result;
193    }
194
195    /**
196     * Returns the name of the styling library or toolkit used by the console.
197     * This value is informative. It may, however, be used by
198     * a {@link PageResourceProviderFactory} to influence the creation
199     * of {@link PageResourceProvider}s.
200     *
201     * @return the value
202     */
203    public abstract String styling();
204
205    /**
206     * @return the prefix
207     */
208    public URI prefix() {
209        return prefix;
210    }
211
212    /**
213     * Returns the automatically generated {@link WebConsole} component.
214     *
215     * @return the console
216     */
217    public WebConsole console() {
218        return console;
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * Sets the console session network timeout. The console session will be
223     * removed if no messages have been received from the console session
224     * for the given number of milliseconds. The value defaults to 45 seconds.
225     * 
226     * @param timeout the timeout in milli seconds
227     * @return the console view for easy chaining
228     */
229    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
230    public ConsoleWeblet setConsoleSessionNetworkTimeout(long timeout) {
231        psNetworkTimeout = timeout;
232        return this;
233    }
234
235    /**
236     * Returns the console session network timeout.
237     *
238     * @return the timeout
239     */
240    public long consoleSessionNetworkTimeout() {
241        return psNetworkTimeout;
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Sets the console session refresh interval. The console code in the
246     * browser will send a keep alive packet if there has been no user
247     * activity for more than the given number of milliseconds. The value 
248     * defaults to 30 seconds.
249     * 
250     * @param interval the interval in milliseconds
251     * @return the console view for easy chaining
252     */
253    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
254    public ConsoleWeblet setConsoleSessionRefreshInterval(long interval) {
255        psRefreshInterval = interval;
256        return this;
257    }
258
259    /**
260     * Returns the console session refresh interval.
261     *
262     * @return the interval
263     */
264    public long consoleSessionRefreshInterval() {
265        return psRefreshInterval;
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Sets the console session inactivity timeout. If there has been no
270     * user activity for more than the given number of milliseconds the
271     * console code stops sending keep alive packets and displays a
272     * message to the user. The value defaults to -1 (no timeout).
273     * 
274     * @param timeout the timeout in milliseconds
275     * @return the console view for easy chaining
276     */
277    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.LinguisticNaming")
278    public ConsoleWeblet setConsoleSessionInactivityTimeout(long timeout) {
279        psInactivityTimeout = timeout;
280        return this;
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Returns the console session inactivity timeout.
285     *
286     * @return the timeout
287     */
288    public long consoleSessionInactivityTimeout() {
289        return psInactivityTimeout;
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Returns whether resources are minified.
294     *
295     * @return the useMinifiedResources
296     */
297    public boolean useMinifiedResources() {
298        return useMinifiedResources;
299    }
300
301    /**
302     * Determines if resources should be minified.
303     *
304     * @param useMinifiedResources the useMinifiedResources to set
305     */
306    public void setUseMinifiedResources(boolean useMinifiedResources) {
307        this.useMinifiedResources = useMinifiedResources;
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Provides the render support.
312     * 
313     * @return the render support
314     */
315    protected RenderSupport renderSupport() {
316        return renderSupport;
317    }
318
319    /**
320     * Prepends a class to the list of classes used to lookup console
321     * resources. See {@link ConsoleResourceBundleControl#newBundle}.
322     * Affects the content of the resource bundle returned by
323     * {@link #consoleResourceBundle(Locale)}. 
324     * 
325     * @param cls the class to prepend.
326     * @return the console weblet for easy chaining
327     */
328    public ConsoleWeblet prependResourceBundleProvider(Class<?> cls) {
329        resourceClasses.add(0, cls);
330        updateSupportedLocales();
331        return this;
332    }
333
334    /**
335     * Update the supported locales.
336     */
337    protected final void updateSupportedLocales() {
338        supportedLocales.clear();
339        ResourceBundle.clearCache(ConsoleWeblet.class.getClassLoader());
340        for (Locale locale : Locale.getAvailableLocales()) {
341            if ("".equals(locale.getLanguage())) {
342                continue;
343            }
344            ResourceBundle bundle = ResourceBundle.getBundle("l10n", locale,
345                ConsoleWeblet.class.getClassLoader(), resourceControl);
346            if (bundle.getLocale().equals(locale)) {
347                supportedLocales.put(locale, bundle);
348            }
349        }
350    }
351
352    /**
353     * Return the console resources for a given locale.
354     *
355     * @param locale the locale
356     * @return the resource bundle
357     */
358    public ResourceBundle consoleResourceBundle(Locale locale) {
359        return ResourceBundle.getBundle("l10n", locale,
360            ConsoleWeblet.class.getClassLoader(), resourceControl);
361    }
362
363    /**
364     * Returns the supported locales and their resource bundles.
365     *
366     * @return the set of locales supported by the console and their
367     * resource bundles
368     */
369    protected Map<Locale, ResourceBundle> supportedLocales() {
370        return supportedLocales;
371    }
372
373    /**
374     * Redirects `GET` requests without trailing slash.
375     *
376     * @param event the event
377     * @param channel the channel
378     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
379     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
380     * @throws ParseException the parse exception
381     */
382    @RequestHandler(dynamic = true)
383    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.EmptyCatchBlock")
384    public void onGetRedirect(Request.In.Get event, IOSubchannel channel)
385            throws InterruptedException, IOException, ParseException {
386        HttpResponse response = event.httpRequest().response().get();
387        response.setStatus(HttpStatus.MOVED_PERMANENTLY)
388            .setContentType("text", "plain", UTF_8)
389            .setField(HttpField.LOCATION, prefix);
390        channel.respond(new Response(response));
391        try {
392            channel.respond(Output.from(prefix.toString()
393                .getBytes(UTF_8), true));
394        } catch (UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
395            // Supported by definition
396        }
397        event.setResult(true);
398        event.stop();
399    }
400
401    /**
402     * Handle the `GET` requests for the various resources. The requests
403     * have to start with the prefix passed to the constructor. Further
404     * processing depends on the next path segment:
405     * 
406     * * `.../console-base-resource`: Provide a resource associated
407     *   with this class. The resources are:
408     *   
409     *   * `jgconsole.js`: The JavaScript module with helper classes
410     *   * `console.css`: Some basic styles for conlets
411     *
412     * * `.../console-resource`: Invokes {@link #provideConsoleResource}
413     *   with the remainder of the path.
414     *   
415     * * `.../page-resource`: Invokes {@link #providePageResource}
416     *   with the remainder of the path.
417     *   
418     * * `.../conlet-resource`: Invokes {@link #provideConletResource}
419     *   with the remainder of the path.
420     *   
421     * * `.../console-session`: Handled by this class. Used
422     *   e.g. for initiating the web socket connection.
423     *
424     * @param event the event
425     * @param channel the channel
426     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
427     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
428     * @throws ParseException the parse exception
429     */
430    @RequestHandler(dynamic = true)
431    public void onGet(Request.In.Get event, IOSubchannel channel)
432            throws InterruptedException, IOException, ParseException {
433        URI requestUri = event.requestUri();
434        int prefixSegs = requestPattern.matches(requestUri);
435        // Request for console? (Only valid with session)
436        if (prefixSegs < 0 || !event.associated(Session.class).isPresent()) {
437            return;
438        }
439
440        // Normalize and evaluate
441        String requestPath = ResourcePattern.removeSegments(
442            requestUri.getPath(), prefixSegs + 1);
443        String[] requestParts = ResourcePattern.split(requestPath, 1);
444        switch (requestParts[0]) {
445        case "":
446            // Because language is changed via websocket, locale cookie
447            // may be out-dated
448            event.associated(Selection.class)
449                .ifPresent(selection -> selection.prefer(selection.get()[0]));
450            // This is a console session now (can be connected to)
451            Session session = event.associated(Session.class).get();
452            UUID consoleSessionId = UUID.randomUUID();
453            @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
454            Map<URI, UUID> knownIds = (Map<URI, UUID>) session.computeIfAbsent(
455                CONSOLE_SESSION_IDS,
456                newKey -> new ConcurrentHashMap<URI, UUID>());
457            knownIds.put(prefix, consoleSessionId);
458            // Finally render
459            renderConsole(event, channel, consoleSessionId);
460            return;
461        case "console-resource":
462            provideConsoleResource(event, ResourcePattern.removeSegments(
463                requestUri.getPath(), prefixSegs + 2), channel);
464            return;
465        case "console-base-resource":
466            ResponseCreationSupport.sendStaticContent(event, channel,
467                path -> ConsoleWeblet.class.getResource(requestParts[1]),
468                null);
469            return;
470        case "page-resource":
471            providePageResource(event, channel, requestParts[1]);
472            return;
473        case "console-session":
474            handleSessionRequest(event, channel, requestParts[1]);
475            return;
476        case "conlet-resource":
477            provideConletResource(event, channel, URI.create(requestParts[1]));
478            return;
479        default:
480            break;
481        }
482    }
483
484    /**
485     * Render the console page.
486     *
487     * @param event the event
488     * @param channel the channel
489     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
490     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
491     */
492    protected abstract void renderConsole(Request.In.Get event,
493            IOSubchannel channel, UUID consoleSessionId)
494            throws IOException, InterruptedException;
495
496    /**
497     * Provide a console resource. The implementation tries to load the
498     * resource using {@link Class#getResource(String)} for each class
499     * in the class hierarchy, starting with the finally derived class.
500     *
501     * @param event the event
502     * @param requestPath the request path relativized to the 
503     * common part for console resources
504     * @param channel the channel
505     */
506    protected void provideConsoleResource(Request.In.Get event,
507            String requestPath, IOSubchannel channel) {
508        for (Class<?> cls : consoleResourceSearchSeq) {
509            if (ResponseCreationSupport.sendStaticContent(event, channel,
510                path -> cls.getResource(requestPath),
511                null)) {
512                break;
513            }
514        }
515    }
516
517    /**
518     * Prepends the given class to the list of classes searched by
519     * {@link #provideConsoleResource(Request.In.Get, String, IOSubchannel)}.
520     * 
521     * @param cls the class to prepend
522     * @return the console weblet for easy chaining
523     */
524    public ConsoleWeblet prependConsoleResourceProvider(Class<?> cls) {
525        consoleResourceSearchSeq.add(0, cls);
526        return this;
527    }
528
529    private void providePageResource(Request.In.Get event, IOSubchannel channel,
530            String resource) throws InterruptedException {
531        // Send events to providers on console's channel
532        PageResourceRequest pageResourceRequest = new PageResourceRequest(
533            WebConsoleUtils.uriFromPath(resource),
534            event.httpRequest().findValue(HttpField.IF_MODIFIED_SINCE,
535                Converters.DATE_TIME).orElse(null),
536            event.httpRequest(), channel, event.associated(Session.class).get(),
537            renderSupport());
538        event.setResult(true);
539        event.stop();
540        fire(pageResourceRequest, consoleChannel(channel));
541    }
542
543    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.EmptyCatchBlock")
544    private void provideConletResource(Request.In.Get event,
545            IOSubchannel channel,
546            URI resource) throws InterruptedException {
547        try {
548            String resPath = resource.getPath();
549            int sep = resPath.indexOf('/');
550            // Send events to web console components on console's channel
551            ConletResourceRequest conletRequest
552                = new ConletResourceRequest(
553                    resPath.substring(0, sep),
554                    new URI(null, null, resPath.substring(sep + 1),
555                        event.requestUri().getQuery(),
556                        event.requestUri().getFragment()),
557                    event.httpRequest().findValue(HttpField.IF_MODIFIED_SINCE,
558                        Converters.DATE_TIME).orElse(null),
559                    event.httpRequest(), channel,
560                    event.associated(Session.class).get(), renderSupport());
561            // Make session available (associate with event, this is not
562            // a websocket request).
563            event.associated(Session.class).ifPresent(
564                session -> conletRequest.setAssociated(Session.class,
565                    session));
566            event.setResult(true);
567            event.stop();
568            fire(conletRequest, consoleChannel(channel));
569        } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
570            // Won't happen, new URI derived from existing
571        }
572    }
573
574    /**
575     * The console channel for getting resources. Resource providers
576     * respond on the same event pipeline as they receive, because
577     * handling is just a mapping to {@link ResourceRequestCompleted}.
578     *
579     * @param channel the channel
580     * @return the IO subchannel
581     */
582    private IOSubchannel consoleChannel(IOSubchannel channel) {
583        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
584        Optional<LinkedIOSubchannel> consoleChannel
585            = (Optional<LinkedIOSubchannel>) LinkedIOSubchannel
586                .downstreamChannel(console, channel);
587        return consoleChannel.orElseGet(
588            () -> new ConsoleResourceChannel(
589                console, channel, activeEventPipeline()));
590    }
591
592    /**
593     * Handles the {@link ResourceRequestCompleted} event.
594     *
595     * @param event the event
596     * @param channel the channel
597     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
598     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
599     */
600    @Handler(channels = ConsoleChannel.class)
601    public void onResourceRequestCompleted(
602            ResourceRequestCompleted event, ConsoleResourceChannel channel)
603            throws IOException, InterruptedException {
604        event.stop();
605        if (event.event().get() == null) {
606            ResponseCreationSupport.sendResponse(event.event().httpRequest(),
607                event.event().httpChannel(), HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND);
608            return;
609        }
610        event.event().get().process();
611    }
612
613    private void handleSessionRequest(Request.In.Get event,
614            IOSubchannel channel, String consoleSessionId)
615            throws InterruptedException, IOException, ParseException {
616        // Must be WebSocket request.
617        if (!event.httpRequest().findField(
618            HttpField.UPGRADE, Converters.STRING_LIST)
619            .map(fld -> fld.value().containsIgnoreCase("websocket"))
620            .orElse(false)) {
621            return;
622        }
623
624        // Can only connect to sessions that have been prepared
625        // by loading the console. (Prevents using a newly created
626        // browser session from being (re-)connected to after a
627        // long disconnect or restart and, of course, CSF).
628        final Session browserSession = event.associated(Session.class).get();
629        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
630        Map<URI, UUID> knownIds
631            = (Map<URI, UUID>) browserSession.computeIfAbsent(
632                CONSOLE_SESSION_IDS,
633                newKey -> new ConcurrentHashMap<URI, UUID>());
634        if (!UUID.fromString(consoleSessionId) // NOPMD, note negation
635            .equals(knownIds.get(prefix))) {
636            channel.setAssociated(this, new String[2]);
637        } else {
638            channel.setAssociated(this, new String[] {
639                consoleSessionId,
640                Optional.ofNullable(event.httpRequest().queryData()
641                    .get("was")).map(vals -> vals.get(0)).orElse(null)
642            });
643        }
644        channel.respond(new ProtocolSwitchAccepted(event, "websocket"));
645        event.stop();
646    }
647
648    /**
649     * Handles a change of Locale for the console.
650     *
651     * @param event the event
652     * @param channel the channel
653     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
654     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
655     */
656    @Handler(channels = ConsoleChannel.class, priority = 10_000)
657    public void onSetLocale(SetLocale event, ConsoleSession channel)
658            throws InterruptedException, IOException {
659        channel.setLocale(event.locale());
660        Session session = channel.browserSession();
661        if (session != null) {
662            Selection selection = (Selection) session.get(Selection.class);
663            if (selection != null) {
664                supportedLocales.keySet().stream()
665                    .filter(lang -> lang.equals(event.locale())).findFirst()
666                    .ifPresent(lang -> selection.prefer(lang));
667            }
668        }
669        if (event.reload()) {
670            channel.respond(new SimpleConsoleCommand("reload"));
671        }
672    }
673
674    /**
675     * Sends a reload if the change of locale could not be handled by
676     * all portelts.
677     *
678     * @param event the event
679     * @param channel the channel
680     */
681    @Handler(channels = ConsoleChannel.class)
682    public void onSetLocaleCompleted(SetLocaleCompleted event,
683            ConsoleSession channel) {
684        if (event.event().reload()) {
685            channel.respond(new SimpleConsoleCommand("reload"));
686        }
687    }
688
689    /**
690     * Called when the connection has been upgraded.
691     *
692     * @param event the event
693     * @param wsChannel the ws channel
694     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
695     */
696    @Handler
697    public void onUpgraded(Upgraded event, IOSubchannel wsChannel)
698            throws IOException {
699        Optional<String[]> passedIn
700            = wsChannel.associated(this, String[].class);
701        if (!passedIn.isPresent()) {
702            return;
703        }
704
705        // Check if reload required
706        String[] consoleSessionIds = passedIn.get();
707        if (consoleSessionIds[0] == null) {
708            @SuppressWarnings("resource")
709            CharBufferWriter out = new CharBufferWriter(wsChannel,
710                wsChannel.responsePipeline()).suppressClose();
711            new SimpleConsoleCommand("reload").toJson(out);
712            out.close();
713            event.stop();
714            return;
715        }
716
717        // Get console session
718        final Session browserSession
719            = wsChannel.associated(Session.class).get();
720        // Reuse old console session if still available
721        ConsoleSession consoleSession
722            = Optional.ofNullable(consoleSessionIds[1])
723                .flatMap(opsId -> ConsoleSession.lookup(opsId))
724                .map(session -> session.replaceId(consoleSessionIds[0]))
725                .orElse(ConsoleSession.lookupOrCreate(consoleSessionIds[0],
726                    console, supportedLocales.keySet(), psNetworkTimeout))
727                .setUpstreamChannel(wsChannel)
728                .setSession(browserSession);
729        wsChannel.setAssociated(ConsoleSession.class, consoleSession);
730        // Channel now used as JSON input
731        wsChannel.setAssociated(this, new WebSocketInputReader(
732            event.processedBy().get(), consoleSession));
733        // From now on, only consoleSession.respond may be used to send on the
734        // upstream channel.
735        consoleSession.upstreamChannel().responsePipeline()
736            .restrictEventSource(consoleSession.responsePipeline());
737    }
738
739    /**
740     * Handles network input (JSON data).
741     *
742     * @param event the event
743     * @param wsChannel the ws channel
744     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
745     */
746    @Handler
747    public void onInput(Input<CharBuffer> event, IOSubchannel wsChannel)
748            throws IOException {
749        Optional<WebSocketInputReader> optWsInputReader
750            = wsChannel.associated(this, WebSocketInputReader.class);
751        if (optWsInputReader.isPresent()) {
752            optWsInputReader.get().write(event.buffer().backingBuffer());
753        }
754    }
755
756    /**
757     * Handles the closed event from the web socket.
758     *
759     * @param event the event
760     * @param wsChannel the WebSocket channel
761     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
762     */
763    @Handler
764    public void onClosed(
765            Closed event, IOSubchannel wsChannel) throws IOException {
766        Optional<WebSocketInputReader> optWsInputReader
767            = wsChannel.associated(this, WebSocketInputReader.class);
768        if (optWsInputReader.isPresent()) {
769            wsChannel.setAssociated(this, null);
770            optWsInputReader.get().close();
771        }
772        wsChannel.associated(ConsoleSession.class).ifPresent(session -> {
773            // Restore channel to normal mode, see onConsoleReady
774            session.responsePipeline().restrictEventSource(null);
775            session.disconnected();
776        });
777    }
778
779    /**
780     * Handles the {@link ConsoleReady} event.
781     *
782     * @param event the event
783     * @param consoleSession the console session
784     */
785    @Handler(channels = ConsoleChannel.class)
786    public void onConsoleReady(ConsoleReady event,
787            ConsoleSession consoleSession) {
788        String principal
789            = WebConsoleUtils.userFromSession(consoleSession.browserSession())
790                .map(UserPrincipal::toString).orElse("");
791        KeyValueStoreQuery query = new KeyValueStoreQuery(
792            "/" + principal + "/themeProvider", consoleSession);
793        fire(query, consoleSession);
794    }
795
796    /**
797     * Sends a command to the console.
798     *
799     * @param event the event
800     * @param channel the channel
801     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
802     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
803     */
804    @Handler(channels = ConsoleChannel.class, priority = -1000)
805    public void onConsoleCommand(
806            ConsoleCommand event, ConsoleSession channel)
807            throws InterruptedException, IOException {
808        IOSubchannel upstream = channel.upstreamChannel();
809        @SuppressWarnings("resource")
810        CharBufferWriter out = new CharBufferWriter(upstream,
811            upstream.responsePipeline()).suppressClose();
812        event.toJson(out);
813    }
814
815    /**
816     * The channel used to send {@link PageResourceRequest}s and
817     * {@link ConletResourceRequest}s to the web console components (via the
818     * console).
819     */
820    public class ConsoleResourceChannel extends LinkedIOSubchannel {
821
822        /**
823         * Instantiates a new console resource channel.
824         *
825         * @param hub the hub
826         * @param upstreamChannel the upstream channel
827         * @param responsePipeline the response pipeline
828         */
829        public ConsoleResourceChannel(Manager hub,
830                IOSubchannel upstreamChannel, EventPipeline responsePipeline) {
831            super(hub, hub.channel(), upstreamChannel, responsePipeline);
832        }
833    }
834
835    /**
836     * The implementation of {@link RenderSupport} used by this class.
837     */
838    private class RenderSupportImpl implements RenderSupport {
839
840        @Override
841        public URI consoleBaseResource(URI uri) {
842            return prefix
843                .resolve(WebConsoleUtils.uriFromPath("console-base-resource/"))
844                .resolve(uri);
845        }
846
847        @Override
848        public URI consoleResource(URI uri) {
849            return prefix
850                .resolve(WebConsoleUtils.uriFromPath("console-resource/"))
851                .resolve(uri);
852        }
853
854        @Override
855        public URI conletResource(String conletType, URI uri) {
856            return prefix.resolve(WebConsoleUtils.uriFromPath(
857                "conlet-resource/" + conletType + "/")).resolve(uri);
858        }
859
860        @Override
861        public URI pageResource(URI uri) {
862            return prefix.resolve(WebConsoleUtils.uriFromPath(
863                "page-resource/")).resolve(uri);
864        }
865
866        /*
867         * (non-Javadoc)
868         * 
869         * @see
870         * org.jgrapes.webconsole.base.base.RenderSupport#useMinifiedResources()
871         */
872        @Override
873        public boolean useMinifiedResources() {
874            return useMinifiedResources;
875        }
876
877    }
878
879}
